## Why do we need this kind of structure?

::: columns
::: {.column width="70%"}
-   Each country exploiting fisheries resources must declare its activities ([**transversal variables**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} like capacity, effort and capture)

-   To whom and why?

    -   [**European Commission**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}, if EU member, used for example regarding [**fisheries agreements**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}
    -   [**RFMOs**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} ([**R**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}egional [**F**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}isheries [**M**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}anagement [**O**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}rganisations) to manage [**population dynamics**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}
![](images/boat_capacity.png){.absolute top="100" left="800" width="22%"}

![](images/capture_effort.png){.absolute top="400" left="830" width="13%"}
:::
:::

# The information system

[Around 4 axes]{style="color:#00a9d6; font-size: 1.5em"}

## The information system

[**Collection**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}: recovery of declarative data (logbook for example), sampling, fleet characteristics, etc.

![](images/si_ob7_en_1.png){.absolute left="150" width="65%"}

## The information system

[**Storage**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}: management, administration of databases to store all these kinds of data and ensure long-term preservation.

![](images/si_ob7_en_2.png){.absolute left="150" width="65%"}

## The information system

[**Treatment**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}: processes of checking/correcting data to ensure quality data with the least possible bias or specific exploitation.

![](images/si_ob7_en_3.png){.absolute left="150" width="65%"}

## The information system

[**Sharing**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}: expertise and coordination at several levels, for research projects, in support of stock assessments, data delivery, etc.

![](images/si_ob7_en.png){.absolute left="150" width="65%"}

# Data collection

[On board and on shore sampling]{style="color:#00a9d6; font-size: 1.5em"}

## Data collection

### [Why do we need to collect these data?]{style="color:#00a9d6"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="60%"}
-   [**Compliance**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} : Regulations from the RFMOs
-   [**Scientific purpose**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} : Stock assessment (catches and biological parameters)
-   [**Provide quality data**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} :
    -   Data independence: limiting conflict of interest between fishing business and regulation
    -   Minimize biases: crew estimations reported in logbook
:::

::: {.column width="25%"}
![](images/offshore_picture.jpg){.absolute top="200" left="700" width="30%"}
:::
:::

## Data collection

### [What do we need to collect ?]{style="color:#00a9d6"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="60%"}
-   [**Estimation catch characteristics**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} of the purse seine fisheries (catch and effort by species, size distribution of the catch)
-   [**Region**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}: Atlantic and Indian ocean
-   [**Sample area**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}: ICCAT and IOTC fishing ground
-   Only [**main ports**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} are covered (Abidjan, Dakar and Victoria)
-   [**Primary sample unit**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}: landing
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}
![](images/offshore_picture.jpg){.absolute top="200" left="700" width="30%"}
:::
:::

## Data collection - On shore

### Declarative data {style="color:#00a9d6"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
-   [**Logbooks**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} data :
    -   fishing activities
    -   capture quantities
    -   target species
    -   buoys
-   [**Landing note**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} informations :
    -   capture quantities
    -   target species
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
![](images/logbook.png)
:::
:::

## Data collection - On shore

### Sampling at port {style="color:#00a9d6"}

-   Technicians during [**landings**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} at ports
-   Individuals [**measurement**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} and [**counting**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}

![](images/observateur.jpg){.absolute top="285" left="205" width="58%"}

## Data collection - On board

### Sampling at sea {style="color:#00a9d6"}

-   [**On board observers**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}
-   Priority : collection of information on [**discards**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} and [**bycatch species**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}

![](images/observer_coverage_ao.png){.absolute top="275" left="50" width="40%"} ![](images/observer_coverage_io.png){.absolute top="285" left="500" width="40%"}

## Data treatment

### Databases corrections {style="color:#00a9d6"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Errors**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} may occur, when:

-   The Excel logbook file is written by the partners, [**declarative issues**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}

## Data treatment

### [Tropical Tuna Treament (T3)]{style="color:#00a9d6"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
![](images/salabardage.png)
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
Why we need this kind of treatment?

-   Globally in the declarative data, [global weight]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} pretty well estimated but significant bias in [species composition]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}

-   A lot of input data in [different]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} unites or scales
:::
:::

## Data treatment

### [Tropical Tuna Treament (T3)]{style="color:#00a9d6"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
![](images/logo_t3.png){width="75%"}
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
A succesion of processes for:

-   standardise logbook data
-   standardise sampling data
-   re-assessment of catches (link to the landing data for example) and correction of the species composition

To go deeper: <https://ob7-ird.github.io/t3/>
:::
:::

## Coordination

### [At European Union scale]{style="color:#00a9d6"}

-   [**R**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}egional [**C**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}oordination [**G**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"}roups
    -   [**Main hub**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} for regional coordination and cooperation
    -   Composed of experts appointed by Member States
    -   [**Continuous**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} process
    -   Ob7 is involve in the RCG Large Pelagics [(https://www.fisheries-rcg.eu/rcg-lp/)](https://www.fisheries-rcg.eu/rcg-lp/){target="_blank"}
-   Aim: to move from a [**"national"**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} to a [**"regional"**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} level.

![](images/rcg_lp.png){.absolute top="70" left="650" width="35%"}

## One specific characteristic

### [Focus on the EU]{style="color:#00a9d6"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="70%"}
-   Normally, each entity negotiates [**on its side**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} and is responsible for providing data
-   In the case of the EU
    -   [**coordination**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} of all tasks (intermediary with RFMOs)
    -   [**guarantees**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} the monitoring of the fishing quota(s) by European fishermen
    -   gives more [**impact**]{style="color:#9a1c1f"} on the international scene
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}
![](images/dcf.png){.absolute top="200" left="850" width="10%"} ![](images/dgmare.png){.absolute top="380" left="850" width="10%"}
:::
:::
